result.execSummary:
The defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 62 days served, consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

- Court set restitution at zero.
- Complete a course in anger management.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: - Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travell Nyckolas Saffold

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Agent at this time does not request time and will contact court for further action if needed. Hearing cancelled.

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in custody.  Andrea L Fendry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 AND 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 62 days served, consecutive to any other sentence. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 15 months, concurrent with any other sentence.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 4.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney James Gregory McCann in court, defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold not in court, in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record.  Stipulation agreement in writing signed and filed.  Defense counsel requested plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in branch 4.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Gregory McCann in court, defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold not in court, in custody.  Angela Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense requests status conference to review discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
No use or posession of dangerous weapons.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Thomas S., or S.P. (D.O.B. 4/14/1999).

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in custody.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
